intro: Randia leucocarpa, commonly known as white-fruited randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that is typically white or pale yellow, containing several seeds. Randia leucocarpa is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
